availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, lumber merchant. Native of Hanover. Married to Mary Hasemeier. Father of John Hasemeier, Elizabeth Hasemeier, Henry Hasemeier, Frank Hasemeier, Catherine Hasemeier, Josephine Hasemeier, Louisa Hasemeier, Emma Hasemeier, Eugene Hasemeier, Edward Hasemeier, and Amelia Hasemeier. Lumber merchant in Covington, Kentucky, in 1860. Lumber merchant in Covington in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 5, p. 739.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington Ward 5, p. 187A.
Williams' Cincinnati Directory for 1861 (Cincinnati: Williams & Co., 1861), 427.
"Deaths," The Kentucky Post (Covington, Kentucky), October 14, 1895, p. 8.
